card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : Saving Grasp can target any creature you own, even one controlled by another player.

card.name: Scorch the Fields
card.ability: Destroy target land. Scorch the Fields deals 1 damage to each Human creature.
card.flavor: "Your fields will turn as black as a ghoul's tongue and fire shall be your only harvest."\n—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : If the targeted land is an illegal target when Scorch the Fields tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. No damage will be dealt to any Human. \n1/22/2011 : Scorch the Fields doesn't target any Humans. You can cast Scorch the Fields even if there aren't any Humans on the battlefield.

card.name: Scorned Villager
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.\nAt the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Scorned Villager.

card.name: Screeching Skaab
card.ability: When Screeching Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.

card.name: Séance
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, you may exile target creature card from your graveyard. If you do, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that card except it's a Spirit in addition to its other types. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : The copy doesn't have haste (unless the card it's copying has haste) and usually won't be able to attack.

card.name: Secrets of the Dead
card.ability: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, draw a card.
card.flavor: "The veil between the living and the dead is so very thin that the whispers of the ancients can finally be heard."\n—Amalric of Midvast Hall
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : Secrets of the Dead's triggered ability resolves before the spell you cast from your graveyard does.

card.name: Shattered Perception
card.ability: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.\nFlashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: "You must shatter the fetters of the past. Only then can you truly act."\n—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

card.name: Shriekgeist
card.ability: Flying\nWhenever Shriekgeist deals combat damage to a player, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: Wounds of the flesh are easy to heal. Wounds of the mind may never be undone.

card.name: Sightless Ghoul
card.ability: Sightless Ghoul can't block.\nUndying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: It blindly marches on Thraben's gates, guided by its master's direful will.

card.name: Silverclaw Griffin
card.ability: Flying, first strike
card.flavor: It patrols the grafs for miles around Thraben, ensuring that the unhallowed do not wake for long.

card.name: Silverpelt Werewolf
card.ability: Whenever Silverpelt Werewolf deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.\nAt the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Silverpelt Werewolf.

card.name: Skillful Lunge
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Valor is a currency of the living that serves us well."\n—Cosper Lowe of the Silbern Guard

card.name: Skirsdag Flayer
card.ability: {3}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a Human: Destroy target creature.
card.flavor: Certain initiates into the Skirsdag cult take a vow of blindness, pledging obedience to none but demonkind.
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : You can sacrifice any Human you control, including Skirsdag Flayer itself. \n1/22/2011 : Because targets are chosen before costs are paid, you can activate Skirsdag Flayer's ability targeting itself and then sacrifice Skirsdag Flayer to pay the cost.
card.name_JP: スカースダグの剥ぎ取り

card.name: Somberwald Dryad
card.ability: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
card.flavor: The Somberwald is her domain, and she has yet to hear an acceptable excuse for trespassing.
card.name_JP: ソンバーワルドのドライアド

card.name: Sorin, Lord of Innistrad
card.ability: +1: Put a 1/1 black Vampire creature token with lifelink onto the battlefield.\n−2: You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +1/+0."\n−6: Destroy up to three target creatures and/or other planeswalkers. Return each card put into a graveyard this way to the battlefield under your control.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : The emblems are cumulative. If you get two of them, creatures you control will get +2/+0. 
1/22/2011 : You can target a token creature with Sorin, Lord of Innistrad's third ability, but it won't return to the battlefield. 
1/22/2011 : If a creature with undying is destroyed by Sorin, Lord of Innistrad's third ability, the undying ability will trigger, but the creature will already have been returned to the battlefield by Sorin. The undying ability won't do anything when it resolves. 
1/22/2011 : If Sorin, Lord of Innistrad somehow becomes a creature, it can be chosen as a target of its own third ability. If Sorin, Lord of Innistrad is still on the battlefield when that ability resolves, it will then destroy Sorin and return him to the battlefield under your control. 
7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers are permanents. You can cast one at the time you could cast a sorcery. When your planeswalker spell resolves, it enters the battlefield under your control. 
7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers are not creatures. Spells and abilities that affect creatures won’t affect them. 
7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers have loyalty. A planeswalker enters the battlefield with a number of loyalty counters on it equal to the number printed in its lower right corner. Activating one of its abilities may cause it to gain or lose loyalty counters. Damage dealt to a planeswalker causes that many loyalty counters to be removed from it. If it has no loyalty counters on it, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action. 
7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers each have a number of activated abilities called “loyalty abilities.” You can activate a loyalty ability of a planeswalker you control only at the time you could cast a sorcery and only if you haven’t activated one of that planeswalker’s loyalty abilities yet that turn. 
7/1/2013 : The cost to activate a planeswalker’s loyalty ability is represented by a symbol with a number inside. Up-arrows contain positive numbers, such as “+1”; this means “Put one loyalty counter on this planeswalker.” Down-arrows contain negative numbers, such as “-7”; this means “Remove seven loyalty counters from this planeswalker.” A symbol with a “0” means “Put zero loyalty counters on this planeswalker.” 
7/1/2013 : You can’t activate a planeswalker’s ability with a negative loyalty cost unless the planeswalker has at least that many loyalty counters on it. 
7/1/2013 : Planeswalkers can’t attack (unless an effect turns the planeswalker into a creature). However, they can be attacked. Each of your attacking creatures can attack your opponent or a planeswalker that player controls. You say which as you declare attackers. 
7/1/2013 : If your planeswalkers are being attacked, you can block the attackers as normal. 
7/1/2013 : If a creature that’s attacking a planeswalker isn’t blocked, it’ll deal its combat damage to that planeswalker. Damage dealt to a planeswalker causes that many loyalty counters to be removed from it. 
7/1/2013 : If a source you control would deal noncombat damage to an opponent, you may have that source deal that damage to a planeswalker that opponent controls instead. For example, although you can’t target a planeswalker with Shock, you can target your opponent with Shock, and then as Shock resolves, choose to have Shock deal its 2 damage to one of your opponent’s planeswalkers. (You can’t split up that damage between different players and/or planeswalkers.) If you have Shock deal its damage to a planeswalker, two loyalty counters are removed from it. 
7/1/2013 : If a player controls two or more planeswalkers that share a planeswalker type, that player chooses one of them and the rest are put into their owners’ graveyards as a state-based action.
card.name_JP: イニストラードの君主、ソリン

card.name: Soul Seizer
card.ability: Flying\nWhen Soul Seizer deals combat damage to a player, you may transform it. If you do, attach it to target creature that player controls.

card.name: Spiteful Shadows
card.ability: Enchant creature\nWhenever enchanted creature is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to its controller.
card.flavor: "Let us remind these human cattle why they fear the shadows of this world."\n—Aldreg, Skirsdag cultist
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : Spiteful Shadows causes the enchanted creature to deal damage to its controller. Abilities like lifelink and infect will apply.

card.name: Stormbound Geist
card.ability: Flying\nStormbound Geist can block only creatures with flying.\nUndying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Strangleroot Geist
card.ability: Haste\nUndying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: Geists of the hanged often haunt the tree on which they died.

card.name: Stromkirk Captain
card.ability: First strike\nOther Vampire creatures you control get +1/+1 and have first strike.
card.flavor: "No longer can we allow our human populations to be mindlessly slaughtered by ghouls. Slay all who trespass."\n—Runo Stromkirk
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : If a creature with first strike deals damage in the first combat damage step, but then loses first strike before regular combat damage, it won't deal combat damage a second time (unless it also has double strike).

card.name: Sudden Disappearance
card.ability: Exile all nonland permanents target player controls. Return the exiled cards to the battlefield under their owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : If Sudden Disappearance's delayed triggered ability is countered or otherwise removed from the stack after triggering, the exiled cards will remain in exile indefinitely. The delayed triggered ability will only trigger once.

card.name: Talons of Falkenrath
card.ability: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)\nEnchant creature\nEnchanted creature has "{1}{R}: This creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn."
card.name_JP: ファルケンラスの鉤爪

card.name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
card.ability: First strike\nNoncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.
card.flavor: "Thraben is our home and I will not see it fall to this unhallowed horde."
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : The ability affects each spell that's not a creature spell, including your own. 
1/22/2011 : The ability affects the total cost of each noncreature spell, but it doesn't change that spell's mana cost or converted mana cost. 
1/22/2011 : When determining a spell's total cost, effects that increase the cost are applied before effects that reduce the cost.
card.name_JP: スレイベンの守護者、サリア

card.name: Thought Scour
card.ability: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: "As you inject the viscus vitae into the brain stem, don't let the spastic moaning bother you. It will soon become music to your ears."\n—Stitcher Geralf
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : If the target player is an illegal target when Thought Scour tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't draw a card. \n1/22/2011 : Follow the instructions in the order listed on the card: if you target yourself, you'll put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard and then draw a card.

card.name: Thraben Doomsayer
card.ability: {T}: Put a 1/1 white Human creature token onto the battlefield.\nFateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control get +2/+2.
card.flavor: "Swarms of the unhallowed claw at Thraben's gates! Do you still deny the end approaches?"
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : A creature whose toughness is being increased by Thraben Doomsayer's fateful hour ability loses that bonus as soon as its controller has 6 or more life (or as soon as Thraben Doomsayer leaves the battlefield). If damage marked on that creature is greater than or equal to its toughness after the fateful hour ability stops applying, the creature is destroyed and put into its owner's graveyard. \n1/22/2011 : If Thraben Doomsayer's activated ability resolves while you have 5 or less life, the creature token will be 3/3 as it enters the battlefield.
card.name_JP: スレイベンの破滅預言者

card.name: Thraben Heretic
card.ability: {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard.
card.flavor: "Let them decry me for burning the dead. I'm not giving those ghoulcallers any more fuel for their madness."

card.name: Torch Fiend
card.ability: {R}, Sacrifice Torch Fiend: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: Devils redecorate every room with fire.

card.name: Tovolar's Magehunter
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Tovolar's Magehunter deals 2 damage to that player.\nAt the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Tovolar's Magehunter.
card.name_JP: トヴォラーの魔道士狩り

card.name: Tower Geist
card.ability: Flying\nWhen Tower Geist enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Jenrik's tower is served by those who once sought to enter it uninvited.
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : If there's only one card in your library when Tower Geist enters the battlefield, you'll look at that card and put it into your hand.

card.name: Tracker's Instincts
card.ability: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put a creature card from among them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.\nFlashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : You must put a creature card from among the revealed cards into your hand if one is there, even if you'd rather put all the revealed cards into your graveyard.

card.name: Tragic Slip
card.ability: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.\nMorbid — That creature gets -13/-13 until end of turn instead if a creature died this turn.
card.flavor: Linger on death's door and risk being invited in.

card.name: Ulvenwald Bear
card.ability: Morbid — When Ulvenwald Bear enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.
card.flavor: Out chasing bears\n—Kessig expression meaning "died in the woods"
card.name_JP: ウルヴェンワルドの熊

card.name: Undying Evil
card.ability: Target creature gains undying until end of turn. (When it dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: "Is it true the evil that people do follows them into death? Let's find out."\n—Liliana Vess

card.name: Unhallowed Cathar
card.ability: Unhallowed Cathar can't block.

card.name: Vault of the Archangel
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{2}{W}{B}, {T}: Creatures you control gain deathtouch and lifelink until end of turn.
card.flavor: "For centuries my creation kept this world in balance. Now only her shadow remains."\n—Sorin Markov
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : Vault of the Archangel's last ability affects only creatures you control when that ability resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn. \n1/22/2011 : Multiple instances of deathtouch or lifelink on the same creature are redundant.

card.name: Vengeful Vampire
card.ability: Flying\nUndying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: He wields the full power of wrath unfettered by the sympathies of a soul.

card.name: Village Survivors
card.ability: Vigilance\nFateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control have vigilance.
card.flavor: As their villages fell to werewolves, fleeing refugees discovered they too had remarkable survival instincts.
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : Tapping creatures to attack with them happens just before any required costs to attack with those creatures are paid. If paying such a cost causes your life total to fall below 6, your tapped attackers will have vigilance, but the ability will have no benefit that combat.

card.name: Vorapede
card.ability: Vigilance, trample\nUndying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: "If you think you've killed one, guess again."\n—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

card.name: Wakedancer
card.ability: Morbid — When Wakedancer enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Hers is an ancient form of necromancy, steeped in shamanic trance and ritual that few skaberen or ghoulcallers comprehend.

card.name: Warden of the Wall
card.ability: Warden of the Wall enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\nAs long as it's not your turn, Warden of the Wall is a 2/3 Gargoyle artifact creature with flying.
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : Warden of the Wall still has the ability to tap for mana when it's not your turn.

card.name: Werewolf Ransacker
card.ability: Whenever this creature transforms into Werewolf Ransacker, you may destroy target artifact. If that artifact is put into a graveyard this way, Werewolf Ransacker deals 3 damage to that artifact's controller.\nAt the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Werewolf Ransacker.

card.name: Wild Hunger
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.\nFlashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Otto the Hunter was filled with many grand ambitions. The snake was filled only with Otto.

card.name: Withengar Unbound
card.ability: Flying, intimidate, trample\nWhenever a player loses the game, put thirteen +1/+1 counters on Withengar Unbound.
card.name_JP: 解き放たれたウィゼンガー

card.name: Wolfbitten Captive
card.ability: {1}{G}: Wolfbitten Captive gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.\nAt the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Wolfbitten Captive.

card.name: Wolfhunter's Quiver
card.ability: Equipped creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player" and "{T}: This creature deals 3 damage to target Werewolf creature."\nEquip {5}
card.flavor: "Steel in the heart, silver in the bow."\n—Wolfhunter's creed
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Only the equipped creature's controller can activate the abilities it gains from Wolfhunter's Quiver. 
1/22/2011 : For each of the activated abilities, the equipped creature is the source of the ability and the damage. For example, if the equipped creature is not an artifact, you could activate either ability targeting a creature with protection from artifacts. 
1/22/2011 : You could activate the first ability targeting a Werewolf creature if you wanted to.

card.name: Wrack with Madness
card.ability: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
card.flavor: The skathul, spirits consumed by revenge, fester and seethe while looking for weak minds to assault.
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : Creature abilities like deathtouch or lifelink may affect the results of the damage dealt.

card.name: Young Wolf
card.ability: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: The Ulvenwald makes no allowances for youth. Today's newborn is either tomorrow's hunter or tomorrow's lunch.

card.name: Zombie Apocalypse
card.ability: Return all Zombie creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped, then destroy all Humans.
card.flavor: "There will come a day so dark you will pray for death. On that day your prayers will be answered."\n—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : All Humans are destroyed, not just ones you control. \n1/22/2011 : If a creature card in your graveyard is both a Zombie and a Human, it will be returned to the battlefield tapped, then be destroyed.
